meta.title: Form Group
meta.description: Easily add some structure to forms. Its purpose is to pair form controls with a legend or label, and to provide help text and invalid/valid feedback text, as well as visual (color) contextual state feedback.

props.description: Disabled the fieldset element, which in turn disables the form controls (on browsers that support disabled fieldsets). Has no effect if 'label-for' is set
Text to place in the label/legend of the form group
Set to the ID of the singular form-control in the form-group. Do not set a value if there is more than one form control in the group.
Visually hides the label content, but makes it available to screen reader users
Text to place in the help text area of the form group
Text to show when the form group has an invalid state
Text to show when the form group has a valid state
Value to use for the 'aria-live' attribute on the feedback text
Number of columns for the label width xs screens and up
Number of columns for the label width sm screens and up
Number of columns for the label width md screens and up
Number of columns for the label width lg screens and up
Number of columns for the label width xl screens and up
CSS class (or classes) to add to the label/legend element
Text alignment 'left', 'center', 'right' for the label xs screens and up
Text alignment 'left', 'center', 'right' for the label sm screens and up
Text alignment 'left', 'center', 'right' for the label md screens and up
Text alignment 'left', 'center', 'right' for the label lg screens and up
Text alignment 'left', 'center', 'right' for the label xl screens and up
CSS class (or classes) to add to the label/legend element
Sets the text size of the label: 'sm', 'md' (default) or 'lg'. Use this prop to have the label size match the form control size
Controls the validation state of the feedback. 'true' force shows valid-feedback, 'false' force shows invalid feedback, 'null' does not force show the feedback
Renders the feedback text in a rudimentary tooltip style
When set, adds the Bootstrap validation trigger class 'was-validated' on the component
